meanings.definition: The action of completely surrounding or covering something.
meanings.sent1: The engulfments of the city by thick fog made it hard to see.
meanings.sent2: The firefighters battled the engulfments of flames to save the building.
meanings.sent3: The engulfments of blankets on the bed made it cozy and warm.
meanings.sent4: The engulfments of vines on the old house gave it a mysterious look.
meanings.sent5: The engulfments of snow on the mountain were breathtaking to behold.

meanings.definition: The state of being overwhelmed or consumed by something.
meanings.sent1: She felt the engulfments of fear as she entered the dark forest.
meanings.sent2: The student experienced the engulfments of stress during exam week.
meanings.sent3: The cat's playful antics led to the engulfments of laughter in the room.
meanings.sent4: His engulfments of love for her were evident in every gesture.
meanings.sent5: The crowd's cheers were an engulfments of support for the team.
